middleware.name: core-make
middleware.desc:
Core Make build system provides the make build files and scripts for building and programming ModusToolbox™ applications. Builds can be run either through a command-line interface (CLI) or through ModusToolbox™ Integrated Development Environment (IDE).
Additional Information:
  • Core Make build system README.md
  • Core Make build system RELEASE.md

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat1b
middleware.desc: 20829 Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming 20829 applications.

middleware.name: mtb-hal-cat1
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Hardware Abstraction Layer package, provides a set of APIs to initialize, configure, and use the PSoC™ 6 MCU resources using the ModusToolbox™ Hardware Abstraction Layer.

middleware.name: btstack-integration
middleware.desc: The btstack-integration middleware library provides Bluetooth porting layer component for PSoC™ 6 targets.

middleware.name: mtb-pdl-cat1
middleware.desc: The Peripheral Driver Library (PDL) integrates device header files, startup code, and low-level peripheral drivers into a single package.

middleware.name: btstack
middleware.desc:
BTSTACK is our Bluetooth® Host Protocol Stack implementation. The stack is optimized to work on our Bluetooth® controllers. The BTSTACK supports Bluetooth® BR/EDR and Bluetooth® LE core protocols. The stack is available as libraries built for Arm® Cortex®-M3 and Cortex®-M4 cores using Arm®, GCC and IAR toolchains. Further there are two build variants of stack libraries, LE only and Dual-mode. Applications that use LE can take advantage of reduced size of LE only library and build LE peripheral or even central applications. Dual-mode library supports both LE and BR/EDR protocols.
Additional Information:
  • BTSTACK release notes
  • BTSTACK API reference manual

middleware.name: ota-update
middleware.desc:
The OTA library provides support for Over-The-Air update of the application code running on a 20829 Bluetooth chip, using Bluetooth. Please see current documentation for currently supported devices. OTA requires the use of mcuboot.
Additional Information:
  • OTA API README.md
  • OTA API reference guide
  • MCUboot documentation
